name: auto-order
script:
# Get Supplier info
supplier_doc = frappe.get_doc("Supplier", doc.supplier)
frappe.log_error(doc.custom_generate_order)

if doc.custom_generate_order == 1 :
    # Proceed only if it's an internal supplier with a target company
    if supplier_doc.is_internal_supplier and supplier_doc.represents_company:
        target_company = supplier_doc.represents_company  # the selling company
        buying_company = doc.company                      # the buying company

        # Get the internal customer representing the buying company
        customer_name = frappe.db.get_value(
            "Customer",
            {"is_internal_customer": 1, "represents_company": buying_company},
            "name"
        )
        if not customer_name:
            frappe.throw(f"No internal customer found representing company '{buying_company}'.")

        # Get default warehouse from target company (if set)
        default_warehouse = frappe.db.get_value("Company", target_company, "custom_default_warehouse")

        # --- build the mirror Sales Order ---
        so = frappe.new_doc("Sales Order")
        so.customer           = customer_name
        so.company            = target_company
        so.selling_price_list = "TP - Alger"
        so.transaction_date   = doc.transaction_date
        so.delivery_date      = frappe.utils.add_days(doc.transaction_date, 7)
    
        # Link the SO to the source PO (header)
        so.inter_company_order_reference = doc.name      # standard field on SO
        so.po_no = doc.name                              # optional: shows PO ref on SO print

        # keep a list of source PO item names to link back later
        source_po_items = []

        for po_item in doc.items:
            source_po_items.append(po_item.name)

            item_row = {
                "item_code": po_item.item_code,
                "item_name": po_item.item_name,
                "description": po_item.description,
                "qty": po_item.qty,
                "uom": po_item.uom,
                "rate": po_item.rate,

                # forward link (SO item → PO / PO Item)
                "purchase_order": doc.name,
                "purchase_order_item": po_item.name,
            }
            if default_warehouse:
                item_row["warehouse"] = default_warehouse
    
            so.append("items", item_row)

        so.insert(ignore_permissions=True)
        # leave it as Draft for manual review
        frappe.msgprint(f"Draft Sales Order {so.name} created for internal customer {customer_name} in {target_company}.")

        # --- back-link on the source PO (header) ---
        frappe.db.set_value("Purchase Order", doc.name, "inter_company_order_reference", so.name, update_modified=False)
    
        # --- back-link each PO Item to the created SO Item ---
        # (the order of SO items matches the append loop)
        so.reload()
        for idx, so_item in enumerate(so.items):
            if idx < len(source_po_items):
                po_item_name = source_po_items[idx]
                # PO Item has these standard link fields:
                frappe.db.set_value("Purchase Order Item", po_item_name, "sales_order", so.name,          update_modified=False)
                frappe.db.set_value("Purchase Order Item", po_item_name, "sales_order_item", so_item.name, update_modified=False)

script:
# Link a submitted Purchase Invoice back to "Buy The Sold"
# Strategy:
# 1) Try PI Item.purchase_order → get that PO.custom_main_command (BTS name)
# 2) save
# 3) Fill BTS items table with Found / Alter / Not Found based on submitted Purchase Invoice


# ---------- helpers ----------
def split_bts_token(token):
    if not token:
        return {"base": None, "suffix": None}
    s = str(token).strip()
    idx = s.rfind("--")  # last '--'
    if idx == -1:
        return {"base": s, "suffix": None}
    return {"base": s[:idx].strip(), "suffix": s[idx+2:].strip() or None}



def pick_first(items, keys):
    for row in (items or []):
        for k in keys:
            if row.get(k):
                return row.get(k)
    return None

def qty_by_item(items):
    """Aggregate PI quantities per item_code."""
    m = {}
    for it in (items or []):
        code = it.get("item_code")
        if not code:
            continue
        # Prefer qty (in stock UOM). If you track in base units, switch to stock_qty.
        q = float(it.get("qty") or 0)
        m[code] = m.get(code, 0.0) + q
    return m



# -------- 1) Resolve the BTS name from the Purchase Order on PI items --------
po = pick_first(doc.items, ["purchase_order"])
if po:
    raw = frappe.db.get_value("Purchase Order", po, "custom_main_command")
    tok = split_bts_token(raw)
    bts_name = tok["base"]
    suffix   = tok["suffix"]


    if bts_name and frappe.db.exists("Buy The Sold", bts_name):
        # -------- 2) Link this PI back to BTS (your existing behavior) --------------
        # Adjust the fieldname if you store PI link elsewhere
        pi_field = "alter_facture_achat" if suffix == "AlterCommand" else "facture_achat"
        frappe.db.set_value("Buy The Sold", bts_name, pi_field, doc.name)
    

        # -------- 3) Build a map: item_code -> qty found on this PI -----------------
        pi_qty = qty_by_item(doc.items)


        # -------- 4) Update each BTS item row --------------------------------------
        bts = frappe.get_doc("Buy The Sold", bts_name)



        if suffix == "Command":
            for row in (bts.items or []):
                item_code = row.get("item")
                # 'sold' is preferred; fall back to 'qty' if that's what you use
                sold_qty = float(row.get("sold")  or 0.0)
                found_qty = float(pi_qty.get(item_code, 0.0))
                alter_qty = max(sold_qty - found_qty, 0.0)
                not_found_qty = max( (sold_qty - (found_qty + alter_qty)) , 0.0)

                # Write back to the child row (make sure these fields exist on the child doctype)
                frappe.db.set_value(row.doctype, row.name, "found",      found_qty)
                frappe.db.set_value(row.doctype, row.name, "alter",      alter_qty)
                frappe.db.set_value(row.doctype, row.name, "not_found",  not_found_qty)
        else:
            for row in (bts.items or []):
                item_code = row.get("item")
                # 'sold' is preferred; fall back to 'qty' if that's what you use
                sold_qty = float(row.get("sold")  or 0.0)
                found_qty = float(row.get("found") or 0.0)
                alter_qty = float(pi_qty.get(item_code, 0.0))
                not_found_qty = max( (sold_qty - (found_qty + alter_qty)) , 0.0)

                # Write back to the child row (make sure these fields exist on the child doctype)
                frappe.db.set_value(row.doctype, row.name, "found",      found_qty)
                frappe.db.set_value(row.doctype, row.name, "alter",      alter_qty)
                frappe.db.set_value(row.doctype, row.name, "not_found",  not_found_qty)
    



    # Done. No need to commit; Frappe handles it for DocType Event scripts.
